info.title: Analytics API
info.description:
The Analytics API lets you review your search, and click and conversion analytics.
> **Note**: The API key in the `X-Algolia-API-Key` header requires the [`analytics` ACL](https://www.algolia.com/doc/guides/security/api-keys/#access-control-list-acl).

PathInPath.name: path
PathInPath.description: Path of the endpoint, anything after "/1" must be specified.

Parameters.name: parameters
Parameters.description: Query parameters to apply to the current query.

ClickAnalytics.name: clickAnalytics
ClickAnalytics.description: Whether to include [click and conversion](https://www.algolia.com/doc/guides/sending-events/getting-started/) rates for a search.

StartDate.name: startDate
StartDate.description: Start date (a string in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`) of the period to analyze.

EndDate.name: endDate
EndDate.description: End date (a string in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`) of the period to analyze.

schema.description:
Method for ordering results.
`clickThroughRate`, `conversionRate` and `averageClickPosition` are only available if the `clickAnalytics` parameter is `true`.

Direction.name: direction
Direction.description: Sorting direction of the results: ascending or descending.

Limit.name: limit
Limit.description: Number of records to return (page size).

Offset.name: offset
Offset.description: Position of the starting record. Used for paging. 0 is the first record.

Tags.name: tags
Tags.description: Filter analytics on the [`analyticsTags`](https://www.algolia.com/doc/api-reference/api-parameters/analyticsTags/) set at search time. Multiple tags can be combined with the operators OR and AND. If a tag contains characters like spaces or parentheses, it must be URL-encoded.

orderBy.description:
Method for ordering results.
`clickThroughRate`, `conversionRate` and `averageClickPosition` are only available if the `clickAnalytics` parameter is `true`.

count.description: Number of tracked _and_ untracked searches (where the `clickAnalytics` parameter isn't `true`).

nbHits.description: Number of hits the search query matched.

searches.description: Top searches with their hits count.

date.description: Date of the event in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

Number of tracked searches. This is the number of search requests where the `clickAnalytics` parameter is `true`.

average.description: Average count of all click events.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of the last update in [ISO 8601](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

FeatureNotEnabled.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

MethodNotAllowed.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

get.description: Returns the most popular of the latest 1,000 searches. For each search, also returns the number of hits.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Index name to target.

parameters.name: clickAnalytics
parameters.description: Whether to include [click and conversion](https://www.algolia.com/doc/guides/sending-events/getting-started/) rates for a search.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date (a string in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`) of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date (a string in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`) of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Reorder the results.

get.description: Returns the rate at which searches don't lead to any clicks. The endpoint returns a value for the complete given time range, as well as a value per day. It also returns the count of searches and searches without clicks.

get.description:
Return the average click position for the complete time range and for individual days.
> **Note**: If all `positions` have a `clickCount` of `0` or `null`, it means Algolia didn't receive any click events for tracked searches. A _tracked_ search is a search request where the `clickAnalytics` parameter is `true`.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Index name to target.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date (a string in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`) of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date (a string in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`) of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter analytics on the [`analyticsTags`](https://www.algolia.com/doc/api-reference/api-parameters/analyticsTags/) set at search time. Multiple tags can be combined with the operators OR and AND. If a tag contains characters like spaces or parentheses, it must be URL-encoded.

average.description: Average count of all click events.
Average count of all click events.

date.description: Date of the event in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

get.description:
Show the number of clicks events and their associated position in the search results.

> **Note**: If all `positions` have a `clickCount` of `0` or `null`, it means Algolia didn't receive any click events for tracked searches. A _tracked_ search is a search request where the `clickAnalytics` parameter is `true`.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Index name to target.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date (a string in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`) of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date (a string in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`) of the period to analyze.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter analytics on the [`analyticsTags`](https://www.algolia.com/doc/api-reference/api-parameters/analyticsTags/) set at search time. Multiple tags can be combined with the operators OR and AND. If a tag contains characters like spaces or parentheses, it must be URL-encoded.

position.description:
Range of positions with the following pattern:
- For positions 1 to 10, the number of click events are shown for each position - For positions 11 to 20, all click events are grouped - For positions 21 and up, all click events are grouped.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.

get.description:
Return the latest update time of the Analytics API for an index. If the index has been recently created or no search has been performed yet, `updatedAt` will be `null`.
> **Note**: The Analytics API is updated every 5 minutes.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Index name to target.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of the last update in [ISO 8601](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

402.description: This feature is not enabled on your Algolia account.

403.description: Method not allowed with this API key.
